dialogue: Got a lot on my mind.
I can tell. Do you want to talk about it?
Whatever it is, my advice will be the same.
You know what to do. We’re only as sick as our secrets.
I need to speak with a detective.
Justin, what's going on?
I need a lawyer.
Give me a dollar.
... And so I went to clear my head and found myself at Rowdy's Hideaway.

I ordered a drink. And I sat there for a while. And then I got up and left. When I got to my car, it was raining. I turned back onto Old Quarry, and went about a quarter of a mile when I hit something. I got out of the car, looked around, didn't see anything and figured it must've been a deer that ran off. Then I got back in the car and drove home.
So, what's the problem?
I got called for jury duty. The Kendall Carter case. They found her body in a creek bed about a quarter of a mile from Rowdy's Hideaway last October.
What are you telling me?
Maybe I didn't hit a deer.
I... don't know what to do.
You were at a bar. You ordered a drink.
I didn't touch it.
Doesn't matter.
Given your history, there's not a jury in the world who's gonna believe you were sober.
But I'd be coming forward voluntarily. That has to count for something.

Your previous DUI’s and the fact that you were at a bar gives the State a reason to charge you with First Degree Vehicular Homicide and maybe Felony Murder. That’s 30 years to life. So, basically, you’re screwed.
Sorry I couldn't meet sooner. What's on your mind?
The trial.
I had a feeling.
It's headed for a hung jury.
That’s right.
So, problem solved?
With the amount of press on this case, the public will demand they retry it. They’ll either do it again with Sythe or, if they decide he’s not the guy, they’ll find the guy.
This case will not end until there's a verdict. But once there is, that's it. It's over.
So you're saying I need a verdict.
I'm just giving you the facts.
Thanks for dropping by. And for the gift.
Thirty-six bucks for a tiny rubber giraffe. But my daughter swore by it when my grandkids were teething.
I'll keep you posted. They're in the doorway now.
You doing all right?
What do you think?
You're a father now. Let it go.
Jesus.
